links.title: $RL Ralph Lauren Named as Official Outfitter of the Australian Open
links.description: The Australian Open and Ralph Lauren Corporation today announced a new, global long-term partnership. Ralph Lauren has been named Official Outfitter of the Australian Open and will outfit all on-court officials, including the AO ballkids and chair umpires, in a specially-designed collection of apparel and accessories.

Long $RL - the current market cap is just below 6bn while $VFC puts a 2.1bn valuation on Supreme. Polo is a legacy brand and not going anywhere. It’s hard to imagine Supreme without thinking of Ralph Lauren. Looks like it could be putting in the bottom of a cup and handle formation; if that’s the case, I see an easy run up to 100.

links.description: An investor can reduce portfolio risk only by holding instruments that are not perfectly correlated. In other words, investors can reduce their exposure to individual asset risk by holding a diversified portfolio of assets. Diversification will allow for the same portfolio return with reduced risk.

messages.body: $RL making new lows, be patient...looks lower before higher

Shares of several retail and apparel companies are trading lower, selling off after positive COVID-19 vaccine news earlier in the week boosted the sector and raised hopes of a rebound in physical store traffic.
